trans-unit.target:
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_SEQ_00<tab>Zukin seeks to test your matchmaking skills.
※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_TODO_00<tab>Help the male striped ray launch bubbles at the female striped ray.

TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ZUKIN_000_000<tab>Mating season for striped rays is upon us. Their courtship rituals are long and complex, and begin with the male propelling a stream of sweet-smelling bubbles at an eligible female.

TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ZUKIN_000_001<tab>However, the females often reject attempts to impress them. The males become despondent as a result, so the ray handlers must encourage them to keep trying until they find a mate.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ZUKIN_000_002<tab>Over by Sui<var 1F /var>no<var 1F /var>Sato is a male ray who is reluctant to continue with the rituals. Perhaps you could assist his trainer?

TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_SYSTEM_000_011<tab>Search for the female striped ray. You may move the camera, as well as zoom in and out. Target the female striped ray and launch bubbles with <var 08 E4E95101 ((<var 48 F20222 /var><var 48 01 /var>)) ((<var 1E 10 /var> / <var 1E 09 /var>)) /var>.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ATTENDANT02991_000_012<tab>Oh, what a pity! That was a fine attempt, but she's just not interested. She seems to turn away all the males though, not just our little friend here.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ATTENDANT02991_000_013<tab>That was very nicely done, but he might need to try a few more times before she pays him any attention.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ATTENDANT02991_000_014<tab>Look at that! This is the first time I've seen her show so much interest! She's ignored every other male until now.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ATTENDANT02991_000_015<tab>Well, it looks like she's had enough for now. We'd better call it a day as well.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ATTENDANT02991_100_015<tab>Our young friend here has made a lot of progress. His technique is slowly improving. Perhaps it won't be long before he finds a match!

TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ATTENDANT02991_000_016<tab>Oh, are you here to help? I have spent all day training him, but he has become sullen and uncooperative. I think a fresh approach might do him some good. Would you like to try?
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ZUKIN_000_022<tab>It would appear that the ray responded well to your instruction. The handler tells me that if he perseveres, he will find a mate sooner or later.

TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ZUKIN_000_023<tab>Striped rays are essential to our way of life, but pairing the males and females can be a little troublesome. In most cases, the males must attempt the mating ritual over and over before they succeed.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ZUKIN_000_024<tab>Since you have a knack for this, we may benefit from your help in the days to come.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_SYSTEM_000_025<tab>The male stares into the distance. With the female gone, he seems at a loss.
TEXT_BANKJN501_02991_ATTENDANT02991_000_026<tab>We will stay here and continue practicing. I am sure that Zukin will be interested to hear how everything went. Fare you well!
